block.p: Natasha Harvey, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Cyrus I. Harvey Jr. of Woodstock, Conn., was married there yesterday to Christopher Danforth Swann, the son of Mary C. Walker and Judge William K. Swann III, both of Knoxville, Tenn. The Rev. James Harrison performed the ceremony at the First Congregational Church of Woodstock.
Mrs. Swann, a graduate of the University of Pennsylvania, and Mr. Swann, who graduated from Duke University, received M.B.A. degrees from Penn, where they met.

Natasha Harvey, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Cyrus I. Harvey Jr. of Woodstock, Conn., was married there yesterday to Christopher Danforth Swann, the son of Mary C. Walker and Judge William K. Swann III, both of Knoxville, Tenn. The Rev. James Harrison performed the ceremony at the First Congregational Church of Woodstock.
Mrs. Swann, a graduate of the University of Pennsylvania, and Mr. Swann, who graduated from Duke University, received M.B.A. degrees from Penn, where they met.

The couple, both 30, work at the Global Food Exchange, an online service in Atlanta that brings together companies buying and selling perishable food products. The bridegroom is a founder and the chief operating officer; the bride is a manager of special projects.
The bride's mother, Rebecca M. Harvey, and father are retired. They founded Crabtree & Evelyn, the toiletries business, which is based in Woodstock.

Mr. Swann also holds a master's degree in international studies from Penn. His mother, a retired lawyer, practiced in Knoxville. His father is a judge of the Knox County Circuit Court, also in Knoxville. The bridegroom is the stepson of Diana E. Swann and of John A. Walker Jr.
